speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Philemon, ho!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Enter PHILEMON

speaker: PHILEMON
text_entry: Doth my lord call?

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Get fire and meat for these poor men:

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: 'T has been a turbulent and stormy night.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: I have been in many; but such a night as this,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Till now, I ne'er endured.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Your master will be dead ere you return;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: There's nothing can be minister'd to nature

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That can recover him.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: To PHILEMON

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Give this to the 'pothecary,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: And tell me how it works.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Exeunt all but CERIMON

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Enter two Gentlemen

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Good morrow.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Good morrow to your lordship.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Gentlemen,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Why do you stir so early?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Our lodgings, standing bleak upon the sea,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Shook as the earth did quake;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The very principals did seem to rend,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And all-to topple: pure surprise and fear

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Made me to quit the house.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That is the cause we trouble you so early;

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis not our husbandry.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: O, you say well.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: But I much marvel that your lordship, having

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Rich tire about you, should at these early hours

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Shake off the golden slumber of repose.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis most strange,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Nature should be so conversant with pain,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Being thereto not compell'd.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: I hold it ever,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Virtue and cunning were endowments greater

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Than nobleness and riches: careless heirs

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: May the two latter darken and expend;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: But immortality attends the former.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Making a man a god. 'Tis known, I ever

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Have studied physic, through which secret art,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: By turning o'er authorities, I have,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Together with my practise, made familiar

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: To me and to my aid the blest infusions

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That dwell in vegetives, in metals, stones;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: And I can speak of the disturbances

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That nature works, and of her cures; which doth give me

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: A more content in course of true delight

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Than to be thirsty after tottering honour,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Or tie my treasure up in silken bags,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: To please the fool and death.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Your honour has through Ephesus pour'd forth

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Your charity, and hundreds call themselves

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Your creatures, who by you have been restored:

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: And not your knowledge, your personal pain, but even

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Your purse, still open, hath built Lord Cerimon

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Such strong renown as time shall ne'er decay.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Enter two or three Servants with a chest

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: So; lift there.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: What is that?

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Sir, even now

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Did the sea toss upon our shore this chest:

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: 'Tis of some wreck.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Set 't down, let's look upon't.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis like a coffin, sir.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Whate'er it be,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: 'Tis wondrous heavy. Wrench it open straight:

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: If the sea's stomach be o'ercharged with gold,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: 'Tis a good constraint of fortune it belches upon us.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis so, my lord.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: How close 'tis caulk'd and bitumed!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Did the sea cast it up?

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I never saw so huge a billow, sir,

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: As toss'd it upon shore.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Wrench it open;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Soft! it smells most sweetly in my sense.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: A delicate odour.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: As ever hit my nostril. So, up with it.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: O you most potent gods! what's here? a corse!

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Most strange!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Shrouded in cloth of state; balm'd and entreasured

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: With full bags of spices! A passport too!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Apollo, perfect me in the characters!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Reads from a scroll

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: 'Here I give to understand,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: If e'er this coffin drive a-land,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: I, King Pericles, have lost

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: This queen, worth all our mundane cost.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Who finds her, give her burying;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: She was the daughter of a king:

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Besides this treasure for a fee,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The gods requite his charity!'

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: If thou livest, Pericles, thou hast a heart

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That even cracks for woe! This chanced tonight.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Most likely, sir.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Nay, certainly to-night;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: For look how fresh she looks! They were too rough

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That threw her in the sea. Make a fire within:

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Fetch hither all my boxes in my closet.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Exit a Servant

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Death may usurp on nature many hours,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: And yet the fire of life kindle again

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The o'erpress'd spirits. I heard of an Egyptian

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: That had nine hours lien dead,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Who was by good appliance recovered.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Re-enter a Servant, with boxes, napkins, and fire

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Well said, well said; the fire and cloths.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The rough and woeful music that we have,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Cause it to sound, beseech you.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The viol once more: how thou stirr'st, thou block!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The music there!--I pray you, give her air.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Gentlemen.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: This queen will live: nature awakes; a warmth

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Breathes out of her: she hath not been entranced

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Above five hours: see how she gins to blow

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Into life's flower again!

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The heavens,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Through you, increase our wonder and set up

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Your fame forever.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: She is alive; behold,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Her eyelids, cases to those heavenly jewels

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Which Pericles hath lost,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Begin to part their fringes of bright gold;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: The diamonds of a most praised water

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Do appear, to make the world twice rich. Live,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: And make us weep to hear your fate, fair creature,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Rare as you seem to be.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: She moves

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: O dear Diana,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Where am I? Where's my lord? What world is this?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Is not this strange?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Most rare.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Hush, my gentle neighbours!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Lend me your hands; to the next chamber bear her.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Get linen: now this matter must be look'd to,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: For her relapse is mortal. Come, come;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: And AEsculapius guide us!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Exeunt, carrying her away
